string-array.name: effects_monsters
string-array.item: The player must use a "Hero Card" (like Heracles) or a combination of "Artifact Cards" to defeat Cerberus.
The player must navigate the labyrinth or use a "Hero Card" (such as Theseus) to defeat the Minotaur.
The player must use a combination of "Fire Cards" or a "Hero Card" like Heracles to defeat the Hydra.
The player must use a combination of "Elemental Cards" (fire, air, and earth) or a "Hero Card" to defeat the Chimera.
The player must use a "Mirror Artifact" or a "Hero Card" (like Perseus) to defeat Medusa without being turned to stone.
The player must use a "Ship Card" or a combination of "Defense Cards" to survive Scylla’s attack.
The player must use a "Ship Card" or a "Storm Card" to avoid being swallowed by Charybdis.
The player must solve a riddle or use a "Wisdom Card" to defeat the Sphinx.
The player must use a "Stealth Card" or a "Hero Card" (like Odysseus) to outsmart the Cyclops.
The player must use a combination of "Hero Cards" and "Elemental Cards" to survive Typhon’s devastating attacks.
The player must use a "Ship Card" or a "Wisdom Card" to resist the Sirens\' call.
The player must use a "Defense Card" or a "Hero Card" to fend off the Harpies.
The player must use a combination of "Flight Cards" or a "Hero Card" to defeat the Griffin.
The player must use a "Strength Card" or a "Hero Card" (like Heracles) to defeat the Centaurs.
The player must use a "Stealth Card" or a "Hero Card" (like Heracles) to bypass or defeat Ladon.
The player must use a "Hunter Card" or a combination of "Strength Cards" to defeat the Calydonian Boar.

string-array.name: effects_artefacts
string-array.item: Grants the player +3 Defense Tokens when equipped, and automatically blocks the first attack from any enemy.
When opened, the player draws 3 Curse Cards but also gains 4 Power Tokens.
Grants the player invisibility for 3 turns, allowing them to bypass enemies or steal an Artifact Card from another player.
Allows the player to deal 3 damage to any enemy at range, ignoring defensive effects.
Allows the player to control the seas, moving freely between water-based spaces and summoning storms that deal 2 damage to all nearby enemies.
Heals the player or an ally for 4 Health Points and removes one negative status effect.
Grants the player +2 Movement Tokens each turn and the ability to avoid traps on the board.
Grants the player +5 Defense Tokens and blocks all damage from the next enemy attack.
Allows the player to sow chaos among opponents, forcing them to discard one card at random and lose 1 Health Point each.
The player may use the Gorgon’s Head to turn any enemy to stone, immediately defeating them without combat.
Grants the player +4 Defense Tokens and immunity to damage for two turns.
Allows the player to deal 4 damage to an enemy and ignore their defense tokens.
Grants the player 3 Health Points and 3 Knowledge Tokens each time it is used.
Allows the player to calm any enemy, forcing them to skip their next attack.
The player may exchange the Golden Fleece to immediately draw 3 Hero Cards or 2 God Cards.

string-array.name: effects_heroes
string-array.item: Hercules can defeat any monster by using his immense strength, ignoring up to 5 defense points of any enemy.
Achilles can deal double damage to any opponent when used in combat, and his defense is unbreakable unless struck by a special attack.
Perseus can defeat any petrifying enemy, such as Medusa, and gains the ability to draw 2 Artifact Cards after each victory.
Odysseus can outsmart any opponent, allowing the player to bypass traps and puzzles on the board. He also allows the player to reroll dice during strategic challenges.
Orpheus can charm any enemy into skipping their turn or ignoring combat altogether, making him a powerful non-violent asset.
Theseus can navigate mazes and defeat labyrinth-bound monsters (such as the Minotaur) with ease, allowing the player to move freely through complex areas.
Jason grants the player the ability to command allies, drawing one extra Hero Card when played and using team-based attacks to deal additional damage.

string-array.name: effects_gods
string-array.item: Artemis grants the player the ability to strike enemies from afar, dealing 3 damage to any target, and allows rerolling for hunting or ranged challenges.
Hades allows the player to revive one fallen Hero or instantly defeat a monster from the underworld.
Apollo grants the player the power to heal 3 Health Points and deal 2 damage to an enemy through radiant energy.
Ares empowers the player with +3 Strength Tokens, allowing them to deal 5 damage to any enemy in combat.
Athena grants the player wisdom, allowing them to solve puzzles or avoid traps, while also adding +3 Knowledge Tokens.
Aphrodite charms any enemy, causing them to skip their next attack, and grants the player +2 Knowledge Tokens.
Hecate allows the player to cast powerful spells, granting +3 Magic Tokens and the ability to bypass a curse.
Hephaestus grants the player an enchanted weapon, dealing 4 additional damage in combat, and allows the creation of an Artifact Card.
Zeus strikes down any enemy with a bolt of lightning, dealing 6 damage and granting the player +3 Power Tokens.
Poseidon grants the player control over the seas, allowing them to move across water spaces and summon a tidal wave to deal 3 damage to all nearby enemies.
Dionysus grants the player 3 Health Points and the ability to confuse enemies, causing them to skip their next turn.
Hypnos puts an enemy to sleep, allowing the player to bypass combat and draw an extra card.
Pan grants the player +2 Movement Tokens and the ability to charm wild creatures, causing them to ignore the player.
Persephone allows the player to return from the underworld, healing 3 Health Points and drawing 2 Knowledge Tokens.
Themis grants the player +3 Knowledge Tokens and the ability to resolve any conflict diplomatically, avoiding combat.
Gaia heals the player for 5 Health Points and grants them control over the land, allowing them to move freely through nature-based spaces.
Demeter allows the player to harvest 4 Health Points and 2 Knowledge Tokens, restoring life and knowledge.
Lyssa grants the player the ability to drive an enemy into a frenzy, causing them to attack themselves and lose 2 Health Points.
Plutus grants the player 5 Power Tokens and allows them to instantly gain an Artifact Card.
Chloris heals the player for 3 Health Points and allows them to summon plant-based creatures or obstacles, blocking enemies for 2 turns.
Eros charms an enemy, causing them to skip their turn and granting the player +2 Knowledge Tokens.
Cybele grants the player +3 Power Tokens and the ability to summon a powerful beast to fight by their side.

string-array.name: failure_monsters
string-array.item: If the player fails, they are blocked for three turns.
If the player fails, they lose 3 Health Points and are forced to skip their next turn.
If the player fails, the Hydra regenerates two additional heads, and the player loses 2 Health Points per turn.
If the player fails, they suffer from the Chimera’s fire breath and lose 4 Health Points.
If the player fails, they are turned to stone for two turns, unable to act.
If the player fails, they lose 3 Health Points and must discard one "Artifact Card."
If the player fails, they lose 2 Health Points and are pulled back 3 spaces.
If the player fails, they lose 2 Knowledge Tokens and must skip their next turn.
If the player fails, the Cyclops crushes them, and they lose 3 Health Points.
If the player fails, they lose 5 Health Points and are banished to a distant part of the board.
If the player fails, they are mesmerized and lose 3 Knowledge Tokens, as well as their next turn.
If the player fails, they lose 2 Health Points and must discard a random card.
If the player fails, they lose 3 Health Points and are knocked back two spaces.
If the player fails, they lose 2 Strength Tokens and must skip their next turn.
If the player fails, Ladon ensnares them, and they lose 2 Health Points per turn until they escape.
If the player fails, they are trampled, losing 4 Health Points.

string-array.name: failure_artefacts
string-array.item: If stolen or lost, the player cannot block any attacks for two turns.
If opened carelessly, the player must endure the curses for three turns, losing 2 Health Points each turn.
If lost, the player is revealed and vulnerable to immediate attack.
If the bow is stolen or broken, the player cannot use ranged attacks for two turns.
If lost, the player cannot travel over water for 3 turns.
If stolen, the player cannot heal for 3 turns.
If lost, the player’s movement is halved for 2 turns.
If stolen or lost, the player cannot defend for 2 turns.
If misused, the player becomes a target, and all other players may focus their attacks on them for one turn.
If lost, the player loses 2 Health Points from its curse.
If stolen or lost, the player suffers 2 Health Points of damage immediately.
If lost or stolen, the player cannot deal damage for one turn.
If lost, the player cannot heal or gain tokens for 2 turns.
If the Lyre is lost or broken, the player loses 1 Knowledge Token and 1 Health Point.
If the player loses the Golden Fleece, they must discard 2 Knowledge Tokens.

string-array.name: failure_heroes
string-array.item: If Hercules is defeated, the player loses 4 Strength Tokens and skips their next turn due to fatigue.
If Achilles is defeated by a critical hit (usually a "Weak Spot" attack), the player loses 3 Health Points.
If Perseus is defeated, the player loses 2 Health Points and one Artifact Card.
If Odysseus is defeated, the player must skip their next turn as they regroup.
If Orpheus is defeated, the player loses 2 Knowledge Tokens and must discard one card.
If Theseus is defeated, the player loses 2 Movement Tokens and skips their next turn.
If Jason is defeated, the player loses 1 Hero Card and 2 Strength Tokens.

string-array.name: failure_gods
string-array.item: If Artemis is ignored, the player loses 2 Movement Tokens and 1 Strength Token.
If Hades favor is lost, the player must discard 2 Knowledge Tokens and skip a turn due to haunting nightmares.
If Apollo’s favor is lost, the player suffers a curse of blindness for one turn, unable to act.
If Ares is angered, the player must forfeit 2 Strength Tokens and discard one Hero Card due to infighting.
If Athena is displeased, the player loses 2 Knowledge Tokens and cannot solve challenges for one turn.
If Aphrodite’s charm fails, the player loses 1 Health Point and discards a random card.
If Hecate is displeased, the player is cursed, losing 2 Health Points and drawing a Curse Card.
If Hephaestus is ignored, the player loses 2 Strength Tokens and one Artifact Card due to a broken weapon.
If Zeus is angered, the player is struck by lightning, losing 4 Health Points.
If Poseidon’s favor is lost, the player cannot cross water spaces for 3 turns and loses 2 Health Points.
If Dionysus is displeased, the player suffers a debuff, losing 1 Health Point and drawing a random Curse Card.
If Hypnos fails, the player loses 2 Knowledge Tokens and skips their next turn.
If Pan’s charm fails, the player loses 1 Health Point and 1 Movement Token.
If Persephone is ignored, the player is stuck in the underworld for 2 turns, unable to act.
If Themis is ignored, the player loses 2 Knowledge Tokens and must face additional challenges.
If Gaia’s favor is lost, the player loses 3 Health Points and cannot use movement bonuses for 2 turns.
If Demeter is displeased, the player loses 2 Health Points and must discard one Artifact Card.
If Lyssa’s rage is misdirected, the player loses 2 Health Points and draws a Curse Card.
If Plutus is displeased, the player loses 2 Power Tokens and cannot draw an Artifact Card for 2 turns.
If Chloris is ignored, the player loses 2 Health Points and cannot use healing abilities for the next turn.
If Eros’ arrow misses, the player loses 1 Health Point and discards one card.
If Cybele is ignored, the player loses 2 Health Points and one Beast Card.

string-array.name: victory_monsters
string-array.item: If the player defeats Cerberus, they earn 5 Knowledge Tokens and can draw an additional Hero or God Card.
If the player defeats the Minotaur, they gain 3 Strength Tokens and may draw a Labyrinth Card to help in future challenges.
If the player defeats the Hydra, they earn 4 Fire Tokens and can draw an additional Hero or Artifact Card.
If the player defeats the Chimera, they gain 3 Elemental Tokens and may draw an additional Elemental Card.
If the player defeats Medusa, they earn 3 Artifact Tokens and may draw an Artifact or Hero Card.
If the player survives Scylla’s attack, they gain 2 Defense Tokens and may draw a Ship Card.
If the player survives Charybdis, they earn 3 Storm Tokens and may draw a Ship or Defense Card.
If the player solves the Sphinx’s riddle, they earn 4 Knowledge Tokens and may draw a Wisdom Card.
If the player outsmarts the Cyclops, they earn 2 Stealth Tokens and can draw a Hero Card.
If the player survives Typhon’s attacks, they gain 5 Elemental Tokens and may draw an additional Elemental or Hero Card.
If the player resists the Sirens call, they gain 3 Wisdom Tokens and may draw a Hero or Defense Card.
If the player fends off the Harpies, they earn 2 Defense Tokens and can draw a Hero or Defense Card.
If the player defeats the Griffin, they gain 4 Flight Tokens and may draw an Artifact or Hero Card.
If the player defeats the Centaurs, they earn 3 Strength Tokens and can draw an additional Hero or Strength Card.
If the player bypasses or defeats Ladon, they gain 3 Stealth Tokens and may draw an Artifact or Hero Card.
If the player defeats the Calydonian Boar, they earn 3 Strength Tokens and may draw a Hunter or Strength Card.

string-array.name: victory_artefacts
string-array.item: If the player uses the Aegis, they gain 4 Defense Tokens and may draw an additional Defense or Hero Card.
If the player uses Pandora’s Box wisely, they gain 3 Elemental Tokens and can draw an Elemental or Artifact Card.
If the player uses the Helm of Darkness, they earn 4 Stealth Tokens and may draw an additional Stealth or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Bow of Heracles, they gain 3 Strength Tokens and may draw a Hero or Strength Card.
If the player wields the Trident of Poseidon, they earn 4 Elemental Tokens and can draw a Water or Elemental Card.
If the player uses the Caduceus, they gain 3 Knowledge Tokens and may draw a Healing or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Talaria, they gain 3 Flight Tokens and may draw an additional Flight or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Shield of Achilles, they earn 4 Defense Tokens and may draw an additional Hero or Defense Card.
If the player uses the Apple of Discord, they gain 3 Chaos Tokens and can draw an Elemental or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Gorgon’s Head, they earn 3 Petrification Tokens and may draw a Hero or Artifact Card.
If the player uses the Nemean Lion’s Skin, they gain 4 Strength Tokens and may draw a Strength or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Sword of Perseus, they earn 3 Strength Tokens and may draw a Hero or Strength Card.
If the player uses the Cornucopia, they gain 5 Resource Tokens and may draw an Artifact or Hero Card.
If the player uses the Lyre of Orpheus, they earn 4 Knowledge Tokens and may draw a Hero or Wisdom Card.
If the player retrieves the Golden Fleece, they earn 5 Knowledge Tokens and may draw a Hero or God Card.

string-array.name: victory_heroes
string-array.item: When Hercules defeats a monster, the player earns 6 Strength Tokens and may draw an additional Artifact Card.
When Achilles triumphs in battle, the player gains 5 Strength Tokens and may reflect 1 damage back to another opponent.
When Perseus defeats an enemy, the player gains 4 Knowledge Tokens and may draw an additional Hero Card.
When Odysseus succeeds, the player gains 5 Knowledge Tokens and may move twice on the board.
When Orpheus succeeds, the player earns 4 Knowledge Tokens and may avoid combat for the next two turns.
When Theseus triumphs, the player earns 4 Strength Tokens and gains the ability to teleport to any location on the board.
When Jason succeeds, the player gains 3 Power Tokens and may draw an additional God or Artifact Card.

string-array.name: victory_gods
string-array.item: Victory: If Artemis helps the player, they gain 3 Hunting Tokens and may draw a Hero or Beast Card.
Victory: If Hades supports the player, they gain 3 Underworld Tokens and may draw a Hero or Artifact Card.
Victory: If Apollo aids the player, they earn 4 Music Tokens and may draw an additional Wisdom or Hero Card.
Victory: If Ares fights with the player, they gain 5 Strength Tokens and may draw a Hero or Strength Card.
Victory: If Athena assists the player, they earn 4 Wisdom Tokens and can draw a Strategy or Hero Card.
Victory: If Aphrodite blesses the player, they gain 3 Charm Tokens and may draw a Hero or Artifact Card.
Victory: If Hecate supports the player, they earn 3 Magic Tokens and may draw a Spell or Hero Card.
Victory: If Hephaestus forges for the player, they gain 4 Crafting Tokens and may draw a Hero or Artifact Card.
Victory: If Zeus aids the player, they gain 5 Power Tokens and may draw an additional Hero or God Card.
Victory: If Poseidon helps the player, they earn 4 Water Tokens and may draw an Elemental or Hero Card.
Victory: If Dionysus aids the player, they gain 3 Celebration Tokens and may draw a Hero or Elemental Card.
Victory: If Hypnos aids the player, they gain 3 Sleep Tokens and may draw a Hero or Dream Card.
Victory: If Pan helps the player, they gain 3 Nature Tokens and may draw a Hero or Beast Card.
Victory: If Persephone assists the player, they gain 3 Underworld Tokens and may draw an Underworld or Hero Card.
Victory: If Themis supports the player, they earn 4 Justice Tokens and may draw a Hero or Wisdom Card.
Victory: If Gaia aids the player, they gain 5 Earth Tokens and may draw a Hero or Elemental Card.
Victory: If Demeter blesses the player, they earn 4 Harvest Tokens and may draw a Resource or Hero Card.
Victory: If Lyssa assists the player, they gain 4 Fury Tokens and may draw a Hero or Strength Card.
Victory: If Plutus aids the player, they gain 5 Wealth Tokens and may draw a Resource or Hero Card.
Victory: If Chloris helps the player, they gain 3 Strength Tokens and may draw a Beast Card.
Victory: If Eros charms the player’s enemy, they gain 4 Knowledge Tokens and may draw a Hero Card.
Victory: If Cybele’s beasts succeed in battle, the player gains 5 Power Tokens and may draw an additional Beast Card.

string-array.name: description_monsters
string-array.item: Cerberus serves as both a formidable foe and a test of a player\'s strategy.
The Minotaur embodies the challenges of navigating one\'s fears and uncertainties.
The Hydra symbolizes the complexity of overcoming multiple challenges simultaneously.
The Chimera represents the fusion of different threats, requiring diverse strategies to defeat.
Medusa illustrates the danger of being paralyzed by one\'s fears and the need for courage.
Scylla signifies the inevitability of facing tough choices and sacrifices in the quest for victory.
Charybdis embodies the unpredictable nature of fate and the need for careful navigation.
The Sphinx presents a riddle that challenges the intellect and cunning of players.
The Cyclops symbolizes brute strength, challenging players to outsmart rather than overpower.
Typhon serves as a reminder of the chaos that can disrupt even the best-laid plans.
The Sirens illustrate the seductive nature of distractions that can lead to one\'s downfall.
The Harpies represent swift, chaotic threats that require quick thinking to overcome.
The Griffin embodies the balance between strength and wisdom, requiring both to defeat.
The Centaurs symbolize the struggle between civilization and primal instincts.
Ladon represents the trials of guarding something precious and the challenges of vigilance.
The Calydonian Boar showcases the ferocity of nature and the need for teamwork to overcome.

string-array.name: description_heroes
string-array.item: Hercules serves as both a challenge and an opportunity for strategic players.
Achilles represents the power of valor and resilience in the face of adversity.
Perseus embodies bravery and cleverness in overcoming great challenges.
Odysseus showcases the importance of cunning and resourcefulness in achieving one\'s goals.
Orpheus illustrates the power of art and music in transforming destiny.
Theseus symbolizes heroism and the triumph of good over evil.
Jason embodies the spirit of adventure and the pursuit of glory.

string-array.name: description_artefacts
string-array.item: The Aegis serves as a powerful shield, representing protection and divine favor.
Pandora’s Box symbolizes the unpredictable consequences of curiosity and temptation.
The Helm of Darkness grants invisibility, embodying the power of stealth and mystery.
The Bow of Heracles represents unmatched precision and the strength of a true hero.
The Trident of Poseidon commands the seas, symbolizing control over nature and power.
The Caduceus signifies balance and negotiation, embodying the duality of conflict and peace.
The Talaria grant swift travel, representing freedom and the pursuit of adventure.
The Shield of Achilles embodies impenetrable defense and the essence of heroism.
The Apple of Discord illustrates the chaos that can arise from envy and desire.
The Gorgon’s Head serves as a weapon of petrification, symbolizing the power to instill fear.
The Nemean Lion’s Skin represents invulnerability, showcasing the strength found in overcoming adversity.
The Sword of Perseus symbolizes courage and the triumph of the hero over monstrous foes.
The Cornucopia signifies abundance and the prosperity that comes from generosity.
The Lyre of Orpheus illustrates the transformative power of music and art.
The Golden Fleece embodies the quest for glory and the rewards of bravery.

string-array.name: description_gods
string-array.item: Artemis embodies the spirit of independence and the connection to nature.
Hades represents the mystery of the underworld and the inevitability of fate.
Apollo symbolizes enlightenment, arts, and the pursuit of knowledge.
Ares embodies the chaos of war and the passion of conflict.
Athena signifies wisdom, strategy, and the strength found in intelligence.
Aphrodite represents love, beauty, and the complexities of human relationships.
Hecate embodies magic, mystery, and the power of transformation.
Hephaestus symbolizes craftsmanship, creativity, and the art of forging.
Zeus represents authority, justice, and the ruler of the gods.
Poseidon embodies the power of the sea and the unpredictable nature of water.
Dionysus symbolizes the joy of life, celebration, and the duality of pleasure and chaos.
Hypnos represents the tranquility of sleep and the escape from reality.
Pan embodies the spirit of the wild and the joy of nature.
Persephone symbolizes the cycle of life and death, and the balance of seasons.
Themis represents justice, order, and the natural laws of the universe.
Gaia embodies the earth and the nurturing aspects of nature.
Demeter signifies agriculture, nourishment, and the importance of fertility.
Lyssa symbolizes madness and the uncontrollable forces of nature.
Plutus represents wealth and the blessings of prosperity.
Chloris embodies the beauty of flowers and the renewal of life.
Eros symbolizes desire, love, and the connection between individuals.
Cybele represents the nurturing aspects of motherhood and the protection of nature.
